definitions: natural process by which living things become older over time
controlled maturation process for wine, cheese, or other products to improve flavor
examples: The aging process affects everyone differently with unique physical changes
Research on aging focuses on extending healthy years of life
Wine aging in oak barrels develops complex flavors over years
Cheese aging requires careful control of temperature and humidity levels

definitions: state of anxiety, nervousness, or emotional upset disturbing normal calmness
physical movement or stirring of liquids, particles, or substances
organized public protest or campaign for political or social change
examples: Her visible agitation made everyone in the room feel uncomfortable
The patient's agitation required immediate medical attention and sedation
Constant agitation keeps the solution properly mixed during the reaction
The washing machine uses agitation to remove dirt from clothing
Political agitation led to major reforms in voting rights legislation
Student agitation on campus brought attention to environmental issues

definitions: person who stirs up public opinion to promote political or social change
mechanical device that creates motion to mix or stir substances
examples: The labor agitator organized strikes for better working conditions nationwide
Political agitators faced arrest for their protest activities last month
The washing machine agitator moves clothes through soapy water effectively
Industrial agitators blend chemicals in large processing tanks continuously

definitions: person who believes knowledge of God's existence is unknowable or uncertain
approach or technology that works independently of specific systems or platforms
examples: The agnostic questioned whether divine existence could ever be proven
Many agnostics maintain spiritual beliefs without committing to organized religion
This platform-agnostic software runs on Windows, Mac, and Linux systems
The vendor-agnostic solution works with equipment from multiple manufacturers

definitions: philosophical position that the existence or nature of God cannot be known with certainty
examples: His agnosticism developed after years of studying different religious traditions
Agnosticism differs from atheism by acknowledging the limits of human knowledge
Scientific agnosticism maintains neutrality on questions beyond empirical investigation
Her agnosticism extended to all metaphysical claims about ultimate reality

definitions: intense physical or mental pain causing severe distress and anguish
examples: The patient writhed in agony until the pain medication took effect
She endured the agony of losing her child in the accident
The athlete collapsed in agony after tearing his knee ligament completely
Waiting for the test results was absolute agony for the family

definitions: open public space in ancient Greek cities used for markets and civic gatherings
examples: The ancient agora served as Athens' commercial and political center
Archaeologists uncovered pottery fragments in the ruins of the agora
Citizens gathered in the agora to debate democratic principles and laws
The agora combined marketplace functions with social and political activities

definitions: harmony of opinion or feeling between people about something
legally binding document outlining terms accepted by multiple parties
grammatical correspondence between words in gender, number, or person
examples: They reached agreement on all major points during the negotiation
The committee came to agreement after hours of heated discussion
Both parties signed the agreement to finalize the business merger
The rental agreement specifies tenant responsibilities and payment terms clearly
Subject-verb agreement requires matching singular subjects with singular verbs
French nouns and adjectives must show agreement in gender and number

definitions: professional who studies or practices the science and business of farming and cultivation
examples: The agriculturalist recommended crop rotation to improve soil fertility naturally
Local agriculturalists developed drought-resistant varieties suited to the climate
Government agriculturalists provide technical support to small-scale farmers nationwide
The agriculturalist analyzed soil samples to determine optimal fertilizer requirements

definitions: science and practice of cultivating land, growing crops, and raising livestock for food
examples: Modern agriculture uses technology to increase crop yields and efficiency
Sustainable agriculture balances productivity with environmental conservation practices
The region's agriculture focuses primarily on wheat and corn production
Climate change poses significant challenges to traditional agriculture methods worldwide

definitions: person engaged in agriculture as a science or business of cultivation
examples: The experienced agriculturist managed three hundred acres of farmland successfully
Local agriculturists formed a cooperative to share equipment and resources
Young agriculturists adopt precision farming techniques using GPS and sensors
The agriculturist diversified crops to reduce financial risk from market fluctuations

definitions: scientist specializing in soil management and crop production to improve agricultural yield
examples: The agronomist tested new fertilizer formulations to maximize corn yields
University agronomists research genetic modifications for disease-resistant crops
The consulting agronomist helped farmers optimize irrigation schedules for efficiency
Agronomists study how different tillage methods affect soil structure and fertility

definitions: scientific study of crop production, soil management, and farming methods to optimize yields
examples: Students majoring in agronomy learn about plant genetics and soil chemistry
Advances in agronomy have dramatically increased global food production capacity
The agronomy department researches sustainable farming practices for local conditions
Modern agronomy combines traditional knowledge with cutting-edge biotechnology innovations

definitions: help, support, or assistance given to someone in need
person who assists or helps another in their work or duties
examples: International aid arrived quickly after the devastating earthquake struck
The government provides financial aid to low-income college students annually
The teacher's aid helped students with their reading assignments daily
She worked as a congressional aid before running for office herself

definitions: person employed to assist someone in their professional or personal duties
examples: The presidential aide prepared briefing materials for the morning meeting
The nursing aide helped elderly residents with their daily activities
Her personal aide managed her schedule and travel arrangements efficiently
The classroom aide provided extra support to students with special needs

definitions: Japanese martial art using an opponent's force and momentum for self-defense through redirecting techniques
examples: She practiced aikido three times weekly at the local dojo
Aikido emphasizes harmony and redirecting aggressive energy rather than striking
The aikido master demonstrated throwing techniques using minimal physical strength
Unlike karate, aikido focuses on circular movements and joint locks

definitions: hinged flight control surface on airplane wings used to control rolling motion
examples: The pilot adjusted the ailerons to bank left around the storm
Damage to the right aileron made the aircraft difficult to control
Modern jets have computer-controlled ailerons for enhanced flight stability
The mechanic inspected both ailerons during the pre-flight safety check

definitions: physical or mental illness, typically minor or chronic in nature
examples: Common childhood ailments include ear infections and stomach bugs
The herbal remedy claimed to cure various minor ailments naturally
Stress-related ailments have increased among office workers during the pandemic
The doctor specialized in treating respiratory ailments in elderly patients

definitions: purpose or intention behind an action or plan
act of pointing or directing something at a target
examples: The aim of the program is reducing childhood obesity rates
Her primary aim was earning a medical degree within five years
His aim improved after weeks of target practice at the range
Take careful aim before releasing the arrow from your bow

definitions: invisible mixture of gases surrounding Earth that we breathe
radio or television broadcasting as a medium
distinctive quality or manner of a person or place
melody or tune, especially in classical music
examples: Mountain air contains less oxygen than air at sea level
The air quality index warned residents to stay indoors today
The show will air tonight at eight o'clock eastern time
Radio stations competed for limited air time during peak hours
She had an air of confidence that impressed the interview panel
The restaurant maintained an air of elegance despite reasonable prices
The soprano sang a beautiful air from the baroque opera
Mozart composed this air for a chamber music performance

definitions: vehicle capable of flight through the air, including airplanes and helicopters
examples: Military aircraft conducted training exercises over the desert yesterday
The museum displays vintage aircraft from World War Two era
Commercial aircraft carry millions of passengers safely each year worldwide
Small private aircraft require different pilot licenses than commercial jets

definitions: group of people who operate and serve aboard an aircraft during flight
examples: The aircrew prepared the cabin for an emergency water landing
Military aircrew undergo extensive survival training before deployment overseas
The entire aircrew received commendations for their professional emergency response
Commercial aircrew must complete regular safety certification and training programs

definitions: small airport or airfield, especially for military or private aircraft use
examples: The vintage biplane landed at the rural airdrome after sunset
Military airdromes dotted the countryside during the second world war
The private airdrome served crop dusters and small charter flights
Local pilots gathered at the airdrome for the annual fly-in event

definitions: delivery of supplies or personnel by parachute from aircraft in flight
examples: Humanitarian airdrops delivered food to the isolated mountain villages
Military forces conducted an airdrop behind enemy lines at dawn
The emergency airdrop included medical supplies and clean water containers
Precision airdrops now use GPS guidance for accurate delivery placement

definitions: area of land set aside for takeoff, landing, and maintenance of aircraft
examples: The small airfield handles mostly private planes and flight training
Fog closed the airfield to all traffic until visibility improved
Military airfields require extensive security measures and restricted access zones
The grass airfield hosts an annual vintage aircraft show each summer

definitions: movement or circulation of air through a space or over a surface
examples: Proper airflow prevents overheating in computer server rooms
The aerodynamic design minimizes turbulent airflow around the vehicle
Restricted airflow through the engine caused performance problems immediately
The ventilation system maintains constant airflow throughout the building

definitions: curved surface designed to generate lift when moving through air
examples: The airfoil shape of bird wings inspired early aircraft designs
Engineers tested different airfoil profiles in the wind tunnel
Racing car spoilers use inverted airfoil shapes to create downforce
The propeller blades have an airfoil cross-section for maximum efficiency

definitions: branch of a nation's armed forces that conducts military operations in the air
examples: The airforce scrambled fighter jets to intercept the unidentified aircraft
She joined the airforce to become a combat pilot after college
The airforce base houses several squadrons of transport and fighter aircraft
Modern airforce operations rely heavily on satellite intelligence and drones

definitions: mechanical structure of an aircraft excluding the engine and instrumentation systems
examples: The aluminum airframe showed fatigue cracks after thousands of flight hours
Modern composite airframes are lighter and stronger than metal ones
Inspectors check the airframe for corrosion during annual maintenance reviews
The damaged airframe required extensive repairs before returning to service

definitions: television or radio program broadcast at a scheduled time
exposure to fresh air for drying or freshening
examples: The documentary's first airing attracted millions of viewers nationwide
The special holiday airing includes behind-the-scenes footage and interviews
The quilts need a good airing in the sunshine today
Regular airing prevents musty odors in stored clothing and linens

definitions: large-scale transportation of supplies or people by aircraft, especially in emergencies
examples: The Berlin Airlift supplied the city during the Soviet blockade
Emergency airlift operations evacuated civilians from the war zone
The military airlift delivered tons of relief supplies after the earthquake
Medical airlift services transport critically injured patients to trauma centers

definitions: company that provides regular passenger or cargo air transportation services
examples: The airline announced new routes to three European cities
Budget airlines have revolutionized affordable international travel options
Major airlines formed alliances to share routes and frequent flyer programs
The airline industry faced unprecedented challenges during the pandemic

definitions: large aircraft designed specifically for transporting passengers on commercial routes
examples: The wide-body airliner can carry over four hundred passengers
Modern airliners feature advanced navigation and safety systems
The airliner made an emergency landing due to engine problems
Boeing and Airbus dominate the commercial airliner manufacturing market

definitions: sealed chamber allowing passage between areas of different air pressure
examples: Astronauts enter the airlock before conducting spacewalks outside the station
The submarine's airlock allows divers to exit while submerged
Hospital airlocks prevent contamination between sterile and non-sterile areas
The airlock system maintains proper pressure in the clean room

definitions: mail transported by aircraft, especially international postal service
examples: International airmail takes five to seven business days typically
The vintage airmail stamps are valuable to collectors today
She sent the documents via airmail to ensure quick delivery
Airmail service revolutionized international communication in the twentieth century

definitions: enlisted member of an air force or person involved in aviation
examples: The young airman completed basic training at the military academy
Experienced airmen maintain and repair military aircraft systems daily
The airman received a medal for exceptional service during deployment
Senior airmen supervise technical operations at the air base

definitions: powered flying vehicle with fixed wings that achieves flight through forward motion
examples: The airplane circled the airport waiting for landing clearance
Wright brothers flew the first successful airplane in nineteen three
Commercial airplanes transport billions of passengers annually around the world
Small airplanes are popular for recreational flying and pilot training

definitions: facility where aircraft take off, land, and receive maintenance and passenger services
examples: The international airport handles over fifty million passengers yearly
Security screening at airports increased significantly after September eleventh
The new airport terminal features restaurants, shops, and lounges
Regional airports provide essential connections to smaller communities nationwide

definitions: powered aircraft that stays aloft using gas lighter than air
examples: The Hindenburg airship disaster ended the era of passenger airships
Modern airships are used for advertising and aerial photography
Military airships provided naval reconnaissance during World War One
Helium-filled airships are safer than hydrogen-filled ones historically used

definitions: portion of atmosphere controlled by a country or designated for aviation
examples: Commercial flights must request permission to enter foreign airspace
Military jets scrambled when unknown aircraft entered restricted airspace
Air traffic controllers manage congested airspace around major airports
International airspace begins twelve nautical miles from coastal boundaries

definitions: speed of an aircraft relative to the air through which it moves
examples: The pilot monitored airspeed closely during the steep descent
Stall occurs when airspeed drops below the critical minimum value
True airspeed differs from indicated airspeed at higher altitudes
The aircraft maintained steady airspeed despite strong headwinds

definitions: current or flow of air moving in a particular direction
examples: The jet stream is a powerful airstream circling the globe
Birds use thermal airstreams to gain altitude without flapping
The ventilation system creates a steady airstream through the tunnel
Airstreams over mountain ranges can cause severe turbulence

definitions: narrow stretch of ground prepared for aircraft takeoff and landing
examples: The remote airstrip serves medical evacuation flights exclusively
Bush pilots land on rough airstrips carved from jungle clearings
The military constructed temporary airstrips for supply missions
Small airstrips connect isolated communities to essential services

definitions: passage through which air reaches the lungs from outside
designated route in the sky for aircraft navigation
examples: The paramedic cleared the patient's airway to restore breathing
Swollen tissues can obstruct airways during severe allergic reactions
Commercial flights follow established airways between navigation beacons
Air traffic control assigns specific airways to maintain safe separation

definitions: passage between rows of seats, shelves, or other arranged items
examples: The bride walked down the church aisle toward the altar
Grocery store aisles are organized by product categories for convenience
Flight attendants demonstrated safety procedures in the narrow aisle
The theater usher guided patrons to their seats using a flashlight

definitions: soft white translucent mineral used for carving ornamental objects
very pale and smooth skin tone or complexion
examples: Ancient Egyptian artisans carved beautiful vases from alabaster stone
The alabaster sculpture glowed softly when backlit from within
Her alabaster complexion showed she rarely ventured into sunlight
The portrait captured her alabaster skin against dark velvet fabric

definitions: device that makes a loud sound to warn of danger
sudden feeling of fear or concern about a threat
examples: The smoke alarm woke everyone when the kitchen caught fire
She set three alarms to ensure she wouldn't oversleep
News of the outbreak caused widespread alarm among local residents
His sudden disappearance raised alarm among family and friends

definitions: large oceanic tuna prized for its white meat in commercial fishing
examples: Fresh albacore sells for premium prices at sushi restaurants
Commercial vessels track albacore migrations across the Pacific Ocean
Canned albacore provides more omega-three fatty acids than skipjack tuna
Sport fishermen prize albacore for their fighting ability and taste

definitions: genetic condition causing complete or partial absence of pigment in skin, hair, and eyes
examples: Albinism affects people of all ethnic backgrounds and nationalities
Vision problems often accompany albinism due to lack of eye pigment
Animals with albinism face survival challenges in the wild
Research into albinism has improved understanding of genetic pigmentation disorders

definitions: person or animal lacking normal pigmentation due to genetic condition
examples: The albino alligator attracts thousands of visitors to the zoo
Albino individuals require strong sun protection to prevent skin damage
The rare albino deer stood out starkly against the forest
Many cultures have myths and superstitions surrounding albino animals
